course_title: Variable Topics Seminar: Political Econ. of Development
class_notes: This PhD-level seminar provides an introduction to current research on political and economic development. We will start by reviewing advances in empirical methods and theoretical approaches, before diving into questions of political institutions, emergence of the state, democratization, historical legacies, political violence, efforts to reform and foreign intervention. The readings will include "classic" texts as well as contemporary "cutting edge" work in political science and economics.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 1870, Section #: 4, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 1-3:45p, Instructor: R. Sexton, Status: Closed
